definition: to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: I stood guard with a rifle on the bank of the river.
sentences.chinese: 我拿着枪站在河岸上放哨。

sentences.english: Soldiers were guarding all approaches to the palace.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在所有通向宫殿的路口放哨。

sentences.english: Two students were assigned to stand sentry duty.
Do you know the order that you keep watch ?
sentences.chinese: 你知道你该去放哨的命令吗？

sentences.english: Mexican officials said the suspect had confessed to being a lookout for the gang.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥官员表示，嫌疑人交待，曾为犯罪团伙放哨。

sentences.english: He told him where the old man, Anselmo, was posted.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他老头儿安塞尔莫放哨的地方。

sentences.english: Are there people picketing against farmers every time they cut down a bushel of corn?
sentences.chinese: 可是每次农民收割小麦的时候都有人在这放哨警戒吗？

sentences.english: But usually little Keogh used to keep nix and call out when he saw her father coming.
sentences.chinese: 但小基奥通常总是放哨，看见父亲来了就大声叫喊。

sentences.english: They often stood sentry on snowy nights.
I can stand guard if you want to give it a try.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想试试，我可以帮你放哨。

sentences.english: It isl fit easily into the trunk of the cruiser.
sentences.chinese: 这几袋行李很容易就塞进了放哨车的后备箱。

sentences.english: The watchman rushed into the room to say that the police were outside.
sentences.chinese: 放哨的人急忙跑进屋里说，警察就在外面。

sentences.english: They used to keep watch at the top of the tree during the war.
sentences.chinese: 在战争期间他们通常在树顶上放哨。

definition: to be on the lookout/to keep watch
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
